Licensing and Permit Information
--------------------------------

The City of Ballinger has by ordinance adopted registration requirements for contractors operating in the city. All licenses run on a yearly non-prorated fee, for the period between Jan. 1 and Dec. 31.

​

Roofing contractors: Shall provide an application with a copy of their general liability insurance, responsible party contacts and a warranty bond (not a license bond).

 

Electrical contractors: Shall provide an application with a copy of their general liability insurance, the TDLR card for the electrical contractors license, and the TDLR card for the designated master electrician.

​

Sign contractors: Shall provide an application with a copy of their general liability insurance, the TDLR card for the electrical contractors license, and the TDLR card for the designated master electrician.

​

Residential wireman contractors: Shall provide an application with a copy of their general liability insurance, the TDLR card for the electrical contractors license, and the TDLR card for the designated master electrician.

​

Plumbing contractors: Shall provide an application with a copy of their general liability insurance, along with the TSBPE card for the designated master plumber.

​

HVAC / mechanical contractors: Shall provide an application with a copy of their general liability insurance, the TDLR card for the contractors license, and the EPA 608 or 609 cards.

​

Alarm contractors: While not required, upon voluntary request the City may issue an alarm contractor or installer who wishes to have a city registration as a supplement to their state licensure.

​

Irrigation contractors: Shall provide an application with a copy of their general liability insurance, along with the TDLR card for the license.

​

BAP / RPZ / backflow contractors: Shall provide an application with a copy of their general liability insurance, along with the TDLR card for the license.

​

The application for licensure can be done in-person at City Hall (700 Railroad Ave.), via email at [rjalomo@baltx.org](mailto:rjalomo@baltx.org), or standard mail.

​

The City may require licensure for other trades in recent updates to our code and ordinance. Call City Hall at 325-365-3511 or email rjalomo[@baltx.org](mailto:BC@BalTX.org) for more information.
